aoop.asteroids.model.game

Class ServerGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • aoop.asteroids.model.game.BaseGame
        • aoop.asteroids.model.game.ServerGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public final class ServerGame
extends BaseGame
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The game class is the backbone of all simulations of the asteroid game. It contains all game object and keeps track of some other required variables in order to specify game rules.

    The game rules are as follows:

    • All game objects are updated according to their own rules every game tick.
    • Every 200th game tick a new asteroid is spawn. An asteroid cannot spawn within a 50 pixel radius of the player.
    • There is a maximum amount of asteroids that are allowed to be active simultaneously. Asteroids that spawn from destroying a larger asteroid do count towards this maximum, but are allowed to spawn if maximum is exceeded.
    • Destroying an asteroid spawns two smaller asteroids. I.e. large asteroids spawn two medium asteroids and medium asteroids spawn two small asteroids upon destruction.
    • The player dies upon colliding with either a bullet or an asteroid.
    • Destroying every 5th asteroid increases the asteroid limit by 1, increasing the difficulty.

    This class implements Runnable, so all simulations will be run in its own thread. This class extends Observable in order to notify the view element of the program, without keeping a reference to those objects.

    Author:
    Yannick Stoffers and qqwy

      double checkVictoryConditionsAndReturnTimeUntilRoundEnd()
      In this function, all victory conditions are checked.
      If they are triggered, corresponding messages are added to this game.

      Victory Conditions:

      void setSpaceships(java.util.List<Spaceship> spaceships)
      Replaces this game's spaceships with the new list of spaceships,
      Afterwards, these are all reset (set to 'alive') and positioned at the center of the screen.
      Used when starting a new game round.
      -> In singleplayer mode, the single ship is rendered in the middle of the screen, pointing up.
      -> In multiplayer, ships are set in a circle, pointing outward.
      void update()
      Method invoked at every game tick.

      • initGameData

        public void initGameData(int roundNumber)

      • addSpaceship

        public void addSpaceship(java.lang.String name,

      • setSpaceships

        public void setSpaceships(java.util.List<Spaceship> spaceships)
        Replaces this game's spaceships with the new list of spaceships,
        Afterwards, these are all reset (set to 'alive') and positioned at the center of the screen.
        Used when starting a new game round.
        -> In singleplayer mode, the single ship is rendered in the middle of the screen, pointing up.
        -> In multiplayer, ships are set in a circle, pointing outward.
        Parameters:
        spaceships - the list to replace this game's spaceships with.

      • update

        public void update()
        Method invoked at every game tick. It updates all game objects first. Then it adds a bullet if the player is firing. Afterwards it checks all objects for collisions and removes the destroyed objects. Finally the game tick counter is updated and a new asteroid is spawn upon every 200th game tick.

      • abort

        public void abort()
        Aborts the game.
        See Also:
        BaseGame.run()

      • getSpaceshipRef

        public Spaceship getSpaceshipRef(int index)

      • destroySpaceship

        public void destroySpaceship(int index)

      • checkVictoryConditionsAndReturnTimeUntilRoundEnd

        public double checkVictoryConditionsAndReturnTimeUntilRoundEnd()
        In this function, all victory conditions are checked.
        If they are triggered, corresponding messages are added to this game.
        Afterwards, the time until the game is over is returned as a number.

        Victory Conditions:
        Singleplayer: All asteroids are destroyed. Multiplayer: Only one ship is left, or all asteroids are destroyed.
        Returns:
        the time until the game round will end, or Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY if this is not yet known.
        See Also:
        hasEnded()

      • hasEnded

        public boolean hasEnded()
        Returns:
        true if the game should restart, false otherwise.
